intro: Cyathea camaguinensis, commonly known as the Camagüey tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Caribbean, specifically found in Cuba. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting its growth and enabling it to store water and nutrients. Cyathea camaguinensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
